result.execSummary:
The defendant Harrel D Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 19 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed. No possession of any controlled substances. No possession of any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.
Obtain/Maintain Full Time employment/school or a combination of both.
Defendant may not have no more than $150.00 of cash at any one time.
No possession of any firearms or weapons. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Any remaining balance at the end of extended supervision will be come immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. Any cash bail on deposit to apply.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harrel D Martin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (27 pages) commencing AUGUST 22, 2014 received and filed.
No reply from defendant or surety, gl

Defendant Harrel D Martin in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 19 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 12 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 MONTHS.
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  

Mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including
the DNA surcharge to be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Any remaining balance at the end of extended supervision will be come immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. Any cash bail on deposit to apply. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any controlled substances. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia.
- Obtain/Maintain Full Time employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Defendant may not have no more than $150.00 of cash at any one time. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated August 21, 2014, received and filed.
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($500.00) ad

14RM036423  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/24/2014
TOT Justice Point

Defendant Harrel D Martin in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CASE HEARD FOR BR. 26.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Parties were to proceed to sentencing, however, defense states that he does not have a copy of affidavit and warrant as to cellphone.  State will email information to Atty Chernin today.
Sentencing is adjourned to 8-22-2014 at 8:30am.  Parties are advised that case is assigned to Branch 17 Judge Stark effective 8-2-2014, Room 313 Safety Building.
Based upon the report submitted by Justice Point indicating a positive THC result, the Court will forfeit the $500 cash bail on deposit and set an additional $500 cash TOT Justice Point with Drug testing, absolute sobriety, no firearms/dangerous weapons.
-FORWARDED TO BRANCH 38 FOR BRANCH 26.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Justice Point Program report dated July 23, 2014; received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Harrel D Martin in court with attorney Michael L Chernin.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant no longer wishes to enter a guilty plea and requests a jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Case set for plea hearing on 5-28-14, 8:30.

14RM018501  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-31-14

Defendant Harrel D Martin in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference in Branch 26. COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

COURT ORDERS DEFENDANT REMOVED FROM GPS MONITORING.
Court orders all other terms and conditions to remain the same.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail AMENDED TO $500 CASH.

Defendant Harrel D Martin in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Harrel D Martin in custody. Dennis Murphy for Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and Electronic Monitoring.  To be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Harrel D Martin in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Harrel D Martin in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
